Why might Avast and Kaspersky flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because it is mining software, which can be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a warning to users that they are installing mining software, which may be used for malicious purposes.
